meanings.definition: To gather or collect in a disorderly manner.
meanings.sent1: She pungles her toys into a messy pile in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The children pungles seashells along the shore.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel pungles nuts in a haphazard fashion.
meanings.sent4: The wind pungles fallen leaves into swirling patterns.
meanings.sent5: He pungles papers on his desk, creating chaos.

meanings.sent1: He only needs a pungles of sugar for his tea.
meanings.sent2: She added a pungles of salt to the soup.
meanings.sent3: The bird ate a pungles of seeds from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: A pungles of rain fell on the dry ground.
meanings.sent5: He found a pungles of coins in the couch cushions.

meanings.sent1: The box contained a pungles of random items.
meanings.sent2: She stirred the soup, creating a pungles of flavors.
meanings.sent3: The artist's painting was a pungles of colors.
meanings.sent4: The closet was a pungles of clothes and shoes.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a pungles of flowers and vegetables.
